repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
This will run even if a TUI is not attached. But I guess that's harmless, and wouldn't gain much if this callback manually checked if a TUI is attached.

The more "proper" way would be to only define this event handler after a TUI attaches. But I think it makes sense to always define it, since we ostensibly plan to support GUIs somehow later.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -974,6 +974,19 @@ do
       end
     end,
   })
+
+  -- Show progress bars in supporting terminals
+  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('Progress', {
+    group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.progress', {}),
+    desc = 'Display native progress bars',
+    callback = function(ev)
+      if ev.data.status == 'running' then
+        vim.api.nvim_ui_send(string.format('\027]9;4;1%d\027\\', ev.data.percent))

comment_data.body: I'll gate this with `if tty`, just like the block above this.

comment_data.body:
in that case can you move it to that block? 

we will need to revisit these to handle when a TUI attaches after startup, I think.

comment_data.body: For some reason this escape sequence give me desktop notification (gnome-shell on Debian Sid, ghostty: master from source) instead of the progress bar. I tested it on the example from docs: ```lua vim.api.nvim_echo({ { 'searching...' } }, true, {kind = 'progress', status = 'running', percent = 10, title = 'term'}) ``` I get the expected result with `vim.api.nvim_ui_send(string.format('\x1b]9;4;1;%s\x07', 33))` (the example taken from https://github.com/ghostty-org/ghostty/discussions/8823).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -974,6 +974,21 @@ do
       end
     end,
   })
+
+  if tty then
+    -- Show progress bars in supporting terminals
+    vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('Progress', {
+      group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('nvim.progress', {}),
+      desc = 'Display native progress bars',
+      callback = function(ev)
+        if ev.data.status == 'running' then
+          vim.api.nvim_ui_send(string.format('\027]9;4;1%d\027\\', ev.data.percent))

comment_data.body: Ah we're missing a semicolon. Thanks for testing!

comment_regular_data.body: Should we do this for `LspProgress` by default as well? Alternatively, do we have any plans to merge `LspProgress` and `Progress` into a single event (or have the default `$/progress` handler emit `Progress` events)?

> Alternatively, do we have any plans to merge `LspProgress` and `Progress` into a single event (or have the default `$/progress` handler emit `Progress` events)?

yes, that. we should deprecate `LspProgress`, LSP should leverage the Progress interface. If anything is "missing" that LSP needs, then... that should be fixed.
Ok I'll leave this PR as is for now then, and whenever we deprecate `LspProgress` in favor of `Progress` this will "just work".

title: feat(tui): draw native progress bars for Progress events
